text:
Wē ċildra biddaþ þē, ēalā lārēow, þæt þū tǣċe ūs sprecan for-þām unġelǣrede wē sindon and ġewæmmodlīċe wē sprecaþ.
Hwæt wille ġē sprecan?
Hwæt rēċe wē hwæt wē sprecan, būton hit riht sprǣċ sie and behēfe, næs īdel oþþe fracod.
Wille ġē bēon beswungen on leornunge?
Lēofre is ūs bēon beswungen for lāre þonne hit ne cunnan. 
Ac wē witon þæt þū eart bilewit and nelle onbelǣdan swingla ūs, būton þū sīe tōġenȳdd fram ūs.
title: Aelfric's Colloquy 1

text:
Iċ ācsiġe ēow, for-hwī swā ġeornlīċe leornie ġē?
For-þām we nellaþ wesan swā stunte nȳtenu, þā nān þing witaþ, būton gærs ond wæter.
Ond hwæt wille ġē?
Wē willaþ wesan wīse.
On hwilcum wīsdome? Wille ġē bēon prættiġe oþþe þūsenthīwe on lēasungum, lytiġe on sprǣcum, onglǣwlīċe, hinderġēpe, 
wel spreċende ond yfele þenċende, swǣsum wordum underþēodde, fācn wiðinnan tȳddriende, swā swā byrgels mēttum oferġeweorce, wiþinnan full stenċe?
Wē nellaþ swā wesan wīse, for-þām hē nis wīs, þe mid dydrunge hine selfne beswīċeð.
Ac hū wille ġē wesan?
We willaþ bēon bilewite būton līċetunge, ond wīse þæt wē būgen fram yfele ond dōn gōd.
title: Aelfric's Colloquy 2

text:
For þām nēdfere nǣni wyrþeþ
þances snotera, þonne him þearf sȳ
tō ġehicgenne ǣr his heonengange
hwæt his gāste gōdes oþþe yfeles
æfter dēaþe heonon dēmed weorþe
title: Bede's Death Song

text:
Nū sculon heriġean heofonrīċes weard,
Meotodes meahte ond his mōdġeþanc,
weorc wuldorfæder, swā hē wundra ġehwæs,
ēċe Drihten, ōr onstealde.
Hē ǣrest sceōp eorðan bearnum
heofon tō hrōfe, hāliġ Scyppend; 
þā middanġeard monncynnes weard,
ēċe Drihten, æfter tēode
fīrum foldan, Frēa ælmihtiġ.
title: Caedmon's Hymn

text:
Moððe word fræt; mē þæt þūhte
wrǣtlicu wyrd, þā iċ þæt wundor gefræġn,
þæt se wyrm forswealg weres ġied sumes,
þēof in þȳstro, þrymfæstne cwide
ond þæs strangan staþol. Stælġiest ne wæs
wihte þȳ glēawra þē hē þām wordum swealg.
title: Exeter Book Riddle 47

text:
Iċ seah wrǣtlīċe wuhte fēower
samed sīþian; swearta wǣran lāstas,
swaþu swīþe blacu. Swift wæs on fōre,
fuglum framra; flēag on lyfte,
dēaf under ȳþe. Drēag unstille
winnende wiga se him wegas tǣcneþ
ofer fǣted gold fēower eallum.
title: Exeter Book Riddle 51

text:
On ǣrdagum wæs wuniende be norþdǣlum middangeardes sum cyning, þe āngan dohtor hæfde.
On his hūse wæs ēac ān cniht óþrum ungelíc.
For þam þe hit ǣr gelamp þæt þæs cyninges huntan miċelne beran gemētton on þam beorgum,
ond hie spyredon æfter him to his denne, and hine þǣr ofslōgon.
title: Sellic Spell

text:
On Ēadgāres dagum, Engla cyninges, wearð Æðelwold tō þǣm bisċophāde ġecoren on Wintan ċeastre, and hine ġehālgode Dunstān sē ærċebisċop on
Cantwara byrġ on þone sunnandæġ sē wæs þæs hālgan Andrēas mæsseǣfenn.
Sōna ongonn sē bisċop Æþelwold þā clericas fram þǣm bisċoprīċe ūt ādrīfan,
forþām þe hie noldon nānne regol healdan, ond hē sette munucas þǣr on heora
stede. Siððan cōm hē tō þǣm cyninge ond bæd hine þæt hē sċolde him ġiefan
ealle þā mynsteru þe ǣr tōbrocene wǣron fram þām hǣðenum. Ond sē cyning
līefde þǣm bisċope þæt, ond sōna ongonn hē þāra munuca ġetimbru ġeedstaðolian ond Godes hūs mid māðmum ġefyllan.
title: Ætherlwold's Reforms

text:
Mæġ gehyran se ðe wyle be þam halgan mædene Eugenian, Philyppus dæhter; 
hu hēo ðurh mægðhad mærlice þeah, and þurh martyrdom þisne middaneard oferswað. 
Sum æþelboren þægn wæs Philippus gehaten, ðone asende se casere Commodus, þe on ðam dagum rixode,
fram Rome-byrig to ðære byrig ðe is gehaten Alexandria. 
And he hine gesette to heahgerefan ofer Alexandrian and Ægyfto lande, 
and het þæt he heolde þa romaniscan gesætnysse. 
Ðæs ðægn Philippus næs na gefullod on Gode, forþan þe cristendom næs þa gyt geond eall cuð, and seo reþe æhtnyss þa gyt næs gestylled. 
His wif wæs gecyged Claudia, be þære he gestrynde twægen suna, Auitum and Særgium, and ane dohtor, Eugenian, þe we embe spræcaþ. 
Ða befæste se fæder Philippus to lare þæt heo on woruldwysdome wære getogen, æfter greciscre uðwytegunge and lædenre getingnysse. 
Eugenia þa, þæt æðele mæden, wel þeah on wisdome and on uðwytegunge.
title: Ælfric's Lives of Saints - Saint Eugenia

text:
Þū, sċeō-wyrhta, hwæt wyrcst þū ūs nytwyrþnesse?
Witodlīċe, cræft mīn is behēfe þearle ēow and nēodþearf.
Hū?
Iċ byċġe hȳda and fell, and ġearcie hie mid cræfte mīnum, 
and wyrce of him ġesċȳ mistliċes cynnes, swyftlēras ond sċẹōs, leþerhosa and brīdelþwangas,
flaxan and fǣtelsas; and nān ēower ne mæġ oferwintran būton mīnum cræfte.
Sealtere, hū ūs fremaþ cræft þīn?
Þearle fremaþ cræft mīn ēow eallum.
Nān ēower blisse brȳcð on ġereordunge oþþe mete, būton cræfte mīnum.
Hū?
Hwylċ manna þurh-werodum mettum þurh-brȳcþ būton swæcce
sealtes? 
Hwā ġefylþ his cleafan oþþe hēddernu būton cræfte mīnum?
Efne, buter-ġeþwēor ǣlċ ond ċȳs-ġerunn losiaþ būton iċ hyrde ætwese for ēow, þe ne furþon nāne wyrta
ēowra brūcaþ būton mē.
title: Aelfric's Colloquy 3

text:
Bæcere, hwām fremaþ cræft þīn oþþe magon wē būton þē līf ādrēogan?
Ġē magon sume hwīle ac nā lange ne wel: sōþlīċe būton cræfte mīnum
ǣlċ bēoda ǣmtiġ byþ, and būton hlāfe ǣlċ mete tō wlǣttan byþ ġehwyrfed.
Iċ heortan mannes ġestrangie, iċ eom mæġen wera and furþon litlingas nellaþ forbīġan mē.
Hwæt seċġe wē be þām cōcce?
Beþurfon wē hine on ǣnigum þinge?
Ġif ġē mē ūt ādrīfaþ fram ēowrum ġefērscype, etaþ ġē ēowre wyrta grēne, ond ēowre flæsċmettas hrēawe, 
ond furþon fǣtt broþ ġē ne magon habban būton mīnum cræfte.
Wē ne reċċaþ his cræftes ne is hē ūs nēodþearf, for-þām wē sylfe
magon sēoþan þā þing þe tō sēoþenne synd, and brǣdan þā þing þe tō brǣdenne synd.
Ġif ġē for-þȳ mē ādrȳfaþ, þonne bēon ġē ealle þrǣlas, ond nān ēower
ne bēo hlāford; þēahhwæþere būton mē ġē ne etaþ
title: Aelfric's Colloquy 4

text:
Iċ eom ānhaga īserne wund,
bille ġebennad, beadoweorca sæd,
eċġum wēriġ. Oft iċ wīġ sēo,
frēcne feohtan. Frōfre ne wēne,
þæt mē ġēoc cyme gūðġewinnes,
ǣr iċ mid ældum eal forwurðe,
ac meċ hnossiað homera lāfe,
heardeċġ, heorosċearp, hondweorc smiþa,
bītað in burgum; iċ ābīdan sċeal
lāþra ġemōtes. Nǣfre lǣċecynn
on folcstede findan meahte,
þāra þe mid wyrtum wunde ġehǣlde,
ac mē eċġa dolg ēacen weorðað
þurh dēaðsleġe dagum ond nihtum.
title: Exeter Book Riddle 5
